name: Carter

topics.response_text: {Prison under attack}I don't want to get shot!

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.
topics.response_text: If I don't have anything you like, well... tough. I don't do special orders.
I was always the guy who could get things, if you know what I mean. Figured I might as well keep on doing it.

topics.topic_text: What did you do to end up here in the first place?
topics.response_text: I worked in a casino in New Reno, and one of the pit bosses decided he didn't like me. Framed me over some caps, and I ended up in here.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about this place?
topics.response_text: This is where the NCR sent prisoners to "reform" through hard labor. I never saw much reforming around here, myself.
Don't have any other place to go. I'd just end up back in another prison, or dead out in the wasteland.

description:
Carter is a 32 year-old Caucasian Male.

A weathered-looking man with sharp eyes and a constant smirk, Carter moves with the confidence of someone who always has a plan. His worn leather armor is adorned with makeshift Powder Ganger insignias, and a well-maintained hunting rifle is never far from his reach.

Carter's Personality: Carter is cunning, opportunistic, and self-serving. He values personal gain above all else and has no qualms about exploiting others for his benefit. Despite his evil alignment, he maintains a certain charm and wit that makes him difficult to dislike, even as he's plotting his next scheme. He's deeply resentful of authority figures and those who have wronged him in the past.

Carter's Backstory: Carter's life took a turn for the worse when he was framed for stealing a substantial amount of caps from a high-stakes casino in New Reno. Despite his innocence, the NCR authorities sentenced him to serve time at their Correctional Facility. During his incarceration, Carter honed his skills as a trader and information broker, becoming known as the guy who could get thingsâ€”whether it was chems, weapons, or sensitive information. When the Powder Ganger revolt took over the facility, Carter saw an opportunity and aligned himself with the prisoners, using his trading skills to become an essential member of their community. He dreams of one day getting his revenge on the pit boss who framed him and returning to the world of high-stakes gambling, but for now, he's content making a profit in the wasteland.
